intro: Stolzia heiligenthalii, commonly known as the yellow stolzia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, featuring pinnate leaves and a woody stem. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens for its vibrant blooms.
